tit.e: "Pine Trees" painted on a folding screen.
tit.cmt: The translator left out the "Zu Byoubu", though, as the article is about a specific painted screen and not just "pine trees" it seems it should be added.

sen.j: 松林図屏風（しょうりんずびょうぶ）は、長谷川等伯の代表作で、6曲1双の屏風画である。
sen.e: "Pine Trees" is Tohaku HASEGAWA's best known work, an ink painting on a pair of six-folded screens.
"Pine Trees" is an ink painting on a pair of six-folded screens, and Tohaku HASEGAWA's best known work.

sen.j: 日本水墨画の最高傑作であり、日本美術を代表する名品。
sen.e: It is the paramount Japanese ink painting and is also a masterpiece that is representative of Japanese art.

sen.j: 長谷川等伯が祥雲寺障壁画（現・智積院襖絵）を完成させた頃、息子の久蔵が26歳の若さで亡くなった。
sen.e: When Tohaku HASEGAWA completed the wall painting formerly at Shoun-ji Temple (present-day the painting on fusuma sliding doors at the Chishakuin Temple), his son Kyozo died young at the age of 26.

sen.e: The way of painting trees indicates the influence of Mokkei whom Tohaku secretly respected as a mentor, but he completely absorbed it as a part of his unique style of painting, not merely imitating his mentor.

sen.j: 等伯の生まれ育った能登の海浜には、今もこの絵のような松林が広がっている。
sen.e: On the seashore of the Noto Peninsula, Tohaku's birthplace, the pines are still standing as drawn in this picture.

sen.e: This ink painting with full of Japanese sensitivity must be the fruit of combination of the scenery of birthplace that Tohaku had in his mind and the technique of Mokkei.
